title: The Cover-Up
description: Michael becomes convinced that Donna is having an affair and puts Dwight on the case, but Pam soon discovers that the suspicions may be true. Meanwhile, Darryl gets revenge on Andy for an earlier incident.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam is on phone and clicking her mouse rhythmically, Jim is clicking his pen equally as much, and Dwight notices]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're talking about me in Morse Code. Well, you know what? Joke's on you 'cause I know Morse Code. Ha!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [chuckles] Yeah. That's what we're doing. In our very limited free time and with our very limited budget, we went and got a nanny and then we went out and took a class on a very outmoded and very unnecessary form of communication just so we could talk about you in front of you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup. That's exactly what we did.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It all started when Dwight was tapping his foot against the leg of his desk. When I asked him to stop, he said, "I will when you lose the baby weight."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very well. I must have imagined it. I apologize. [Pam clacking her stapler and Jim responding with tapping his keyboard rhythmically] Detonator. Detonator where? Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim. Are you clicking a detonator?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's a pen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get back to work, Dwight. Please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fine. [clears throat] Hey. Tap away. [Dwight puts noise-cancelling headphones on and Pam and Jim begin to blink rhythmically]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ooh! Things with Donna are so... oh-ho-ho! They're going great. I, uh... we're just clicking on every level. Emotionally and sexually and... orally and I am not used to relationships going this well. I'm actually having trouble focusing on my job. And I like it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who enjoys the weekends? [all raise hands] Of course. Now the weekend is always great if you have someone, which I do. I have Donna. She is hot. She has a Pilates butt. But we need to find something to do this weekend beside have sex. Did I say that? Yes, I did. [all nod] And the reason you are here is that I need ideas for things that Donna and I could do on the weekend.  So just shout it out.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I have an idea for your weekend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Let me get back to my desk right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, you get out of here, big dog. [high-fives Stanley] Ah, no, no, no, no. You guys sit down. I need ideas.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Stanley got to go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, Stanley doesn't help with anything. Come on. Shout 'em out, shout 'em out.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Walk around apple orchards.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Super romantic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's fun.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eel fishing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Curl up with your favorite DVD.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You and Donna should hit the Poconos. They have heart-shaped Jacuzzis. Room enough for three.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We actually went to the Poconos last Tuesday. We headed up there, we went to a little Chinese bistro, um, P.F. Chang's.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Wait, why would you go all the way to the Poconos to P.F. Chang's when we have the Great Wall in Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because when your super-hot girlfriend says, "I wanna go to Mount Pocono," you go to Mount Pocono and you do her. And we screwed. Whoops. TMI.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Wait, that's crazy far. Are you sure she's not cheating?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, Kelly? This is the real world. Not The Real World:

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Does she leave the room when she takes phone calls? Does she keep perfume in her purse? Does she shower before sex? Does she shower after sex? Does she...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, she does all that.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Sorry, dude.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, do not let your imagination run amok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Run what?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Amok. It means, don't let your imagination run out of control.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why didn't you just say that, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, do not let your imagination run out of control.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that's easy for you to say. You have a bad imagination. It's stupid. I live in a fantasy world.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, Jim, I do. And I can't stay in a relationship that is full of lies and deceit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But you didn't believe any of this was true five minutes ago.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's what makes it so wrong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ever since I found out that Donna might be cheating on me, I have not eaten or slept. This not knowing, that's what's killing me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, God, that tickles. What did...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [whispers] I want someone to follow Donna. I want her tailed. I need the name of a good private investigator.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think I've got one for you. [hands Michael a business card]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is you. How much do you charge?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: $100 a day, plus expenses.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll give you $50. Money's no object.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm just gonna warn you... and I say this to all my clients... you might not like what I find.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And you might not like how I find it. [slides over table, leaves]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Of course. Yeah, that's terrible. Okay, let me get back to you. Hey, Stanley. One of my clients just called and said that their Sabre printer started smoking and caught on fire.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: My doctor told me to cut out hot dogs. We all got problems.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Gabe I need to talk to you about something. It's really important.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: There's no way that you guys have any almond butter, right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, I don't know. Look, one of my clients called. He was in the middle of a big printing job and the back of the printer started smoking and then the paper tray caught on fire.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: That's weird. I haven't heard of that happening. I would even settle for apricot preserves.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What are we gonna do about this?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I don't know. Call HQ, see if they know anything. Yeah. That's what I'll do today. All right. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let me know what they say.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [puts newspaper down] Wow. That dude is good.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You didn't feel like he was hiding something?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Like he was... covering something up? Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Two years ago, Andy blamed the warehouse for a late shipment that he forgot to process. We got yelled at pretty bad. Almost lost my job, and I was mad as hell at the time. But I said "Darryl, just wait. He's a fool. There's gonna be an opportunity. Just be patient." [smiles]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sitting on his Firebird's hood in front of a gym] Hi stranger.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Oh, hi. You work for Michael.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I work with Michael.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute. [they shake hands]

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Donna, hi.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All cases are solved with logic. The only logical way to find out if Donna Is a cheater is to seduce her, bring her to orgasm, then call Michael and tell him the sad news.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's interesting. Wow, it's a little early for ice cream, don't you think?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's never too early for ice cream, Jim. But we didn't have any ice cream, so this is mayonnaise and black olives.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, my God

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's comfort food, all right? [disgustedly] God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know Michael, this whole Donna thing is gonna be okay, you just... stop beating yourself up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. Well, I hope you're right. We'll see what Dwight says.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why do we have to see what Dwight says?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because I have him investigating her. I'm waiting for a text update.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, no...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. Undo that. Undo that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's too late to undo it. I need to know. Otherwise this thing is going to spiral out of amok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael. Okay, I'm... I'm going to talk straight to you because I think you need to hear it. Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: God, this is so disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Stop eating it! Do you wanna be happy? Look at you. You have a major self-destructive streak in you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And you kind of torpedo every romantic relationship you're in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's not true. [Pam stares him down] You're right, I ruin everything. And I've known some wonderful women. Holly, Carol, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Helene.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Helene?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My mother.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My mother, Helene. [Jim shakes his head]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. Yes, yes. Yes. All of, all of the greatest loves of my life.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You should stop this, [pulls away mayo and olives bowl] and you should call Dwight right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] All right. [calls Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [at gym, looks ready to work out, checks phone, and tries to grab Donna's attention] Oh, gosh, we were both going for the same weight at the same time; you go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's all yours. [strains loudly to lift two dumbbells and a free weight chained to strap around his head] Ah! [after first rep, Dwight is injured]

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: You okay?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm good. Hey, you know an exercise for two people that uses the whole body?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: [chuckles] Yeah, I think I know what you're talking about.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Tractor pulling. Too bad there's not a tractor here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [moaning loudly on exercise machine while staring at Donna who's next to him] Oh. Oh. Oh. [groans loudly] One thing you need to know about me. I don't quit until something tears or pops. [chuckles] You look like you're getting a good workout. Can I feel your pulse?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Nope. I'm good, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really? Hey, um... [Dwight gets up and walks sorely from his "workout"]

quotes.speaker: Old Lady
quotes.text: Look, young man, can you wipe down that seat?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get out of my way. Huh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Tomorrow's fertilizer, am I right?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: I'm out of here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Donna. Donna, wait, please. I'm sorry. Okay? Listen. We both know why I'm here:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're back. What happened?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, I pulled muscles in both my thighs. Thanks for asking.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, what happened with Donna?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, no. She's not cheating. Oh, man! Will you help me work out this knot? Right here. [near his groin]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ugh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Put your fingers here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No! Are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm positive. Yeah, oh, and here's your expense receipts right there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who eats eight protein bars?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: People who don't trust egg whites.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well, I am just glad this is all over.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, me too. And by the way, uh, I told her not to, but she's coming over here and she's furious.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? No, she didn't say that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're right. I was paraphrasing. What she actually said was, [pulls out notebook] "What is with him? He is crazy. I'm coming over there to talk to him." And this was after I have no other recourse but to tell her and gym security that you had me sent there to see if she was cheating. Also, I joined the gym. You'll be billed monthly. [lays down gym membership receipt on a chair in Michael's office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am not paying for that membership.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sitting on the floor behind Erin's desk, sighs] Ohhh... mmm...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Maybe you'd be more comfortable in your own office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I like the attention. Is she here yet?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Uh, no. [Michael sighs, Donna enters] Wait, yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's her?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm. Right. Right. Right. [Michael pretends to be speaking on the phone as Donna approaches] Okay, I'll talk to you later.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: How could you think I would cheat on you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn't. Everybody else here did. Everybody convinced me that something was up. They poisoned my mind.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: That's pathetic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ye... pfff. Well, no. It's a lie. That's not what happened. I just like you. I can't believe I get to be with you. You work at an adult arcade. You could have any man you want.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: When I tell you I like you, you need to trust me, not some freak. [Dwight is gulping some sort of power shake]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you wanna dump me, I totally get it.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: I told you I like you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you are boner-ific. [Donna laughs]

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Hey, if I said that we should go away for a couple of days, you would...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...poop my pants.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Have you ever been to Vero Beach?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God, Vero Beach. No. Is that on the water?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: We're going.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We are?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What's up? I got your e-mail.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Close the door.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I don't have a plan exactly. More of a loose structure. Gives me freedom to improvise. It's like jazz. [scatting] Andy don't mess with me. [continues scatting] I'll figure something out.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Some freaky stuff going on. I was walking behind Gabe and I heard some things.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Such as?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It was kind of mumbled, I don't know, uh, only thing I could make out clearly was "Andy," "Problem," "Eliminate," something. I don't know what it meant.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What? You don't know what it meant? How about "Andy is a problem and we must eliminate him?"

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Whoa. I hadn't even thought of that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [chuckles nervously] Yeah. Hah. Hoo.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, hey, I love your earrings.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Did Michael get them for you?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: No, I bought them myself.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Where?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Steamtown Mall.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Claire's? Zales? Ricky's? Earring, Earrings? Fancy Girl? Platinum Cat? Where?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: You know, I actually got them in Philadelphia, in a mall down there.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Franklin Mills? King of Prussia? Springfield? Governor's Place?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Uh, Franklin Mills.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Pam] What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm? Oh. It's probably nothing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, heart-shaped jewelry is not something that a woman buys for herself. A man definitely bought it for her recently, and it wasn't Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, so are you... you like heart-shaped jewelry, though, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. Except for the pendant that you bought me. Which I love.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Psst... [Creed walks by Andy and draws his right index finger across his neck, further scaring Andy, Andy looks over at Darryl who is staring him down]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Creed's head of quality assurance. So he'd definitely be wrapped up in this.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: So there I am, minding my own business and Darnell offers me three bucks. All I gotta do is walk by Andy and go like this. [draws finger across neck] Darnell's a chump. I would have done it for anything. I've done a lot more for a lot less.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So it turns out Donna and I have a facebook friend of a friend in common, so I was able to see some of her pictures online. [pulls out picture of Donna embracing a man and smiling] This was taken two weeks ago. And this was taken the same night. [pulls out a picture of Donna kissing the same man] This photo was taken this morning. [shows a baby picture] It's Cece. [laughs] She's never gonna do anything wrong.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Isn't that something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. [Pam knocks on Michaels door and goes in] That's exciting.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sorry to interrupt you. Um, I actually have something very important to talk to you about, business related.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well it can wait. It can wait.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I lied it's personal. It's about me and Jim. We're... I just... you're the only person I can talk to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim is her husband.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And they are having problems, so sh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, not... we're not... we're not having problems. But it is personal. And I would love...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good in bed.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes. Yes, I desperately want to speak with you about my sex life with Jim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God. Look at how cheap street level rooms are. Am I the only person who enjoys people watching?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [loudly] I need you to sign this! So bad!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, weirdo.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I love [leans over Michael's desk to look at his computer screen]... this idea is neat. I've never been. It sounds lovely. [meanwhile Michael looks at the pictures Pam printed out]

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Yeah I think it'll be a nice trip. We're gonna get a lot done.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Michael] You're gonna wanna look at the date on that.  Oh, wow. Look at... golfing. [to Donna] Are you a golfer?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: I am, but I, I gave my clubs away. I swear too much. [Pam and Donna both laugh] Hey, you okay? [to Michael, walking away disappointedly]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I just remembered that I have to go to the bathroom. Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Absolutely. [both leave Michael's office]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Look, I'm not down there anymore, so if the guys start making fun of you, you just, you gotta stand up for yourself.

quotes.speaker: Glen
quotes.text: I know, it's just, I'm scared...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Your text said 911.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Glen, could you excuse us? [Andy slams the door after Glen leaves, panting heavily]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's bad.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What's bad?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's real bad.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Still no plan.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's getting bigger.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I might have to go public here, but no one's gonna believe me. Uh... I need proof. I need, like, a printer to catch on fire.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I can videotape it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [to camera] There it is.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: There what is?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who the hell is this? Who is this guy?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know who he is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: God! Lowest of the low. That guy. Just a notch above Toby. You know what?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm gonna kill him. No, I'm not. I feel... I... no, I'm not going to kill him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You just have to go in there. You have to hear it from her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have to hear it from her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You have to settle down first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need to have her tell me herself. Right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Okay. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need to have her say...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, but you have to calm...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need to say, "What the hell is that? What the hell is that?"

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Look at this, look at this. Baby picture.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, God! No, no, oh, my God!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [in baby voice] Hi, Michael, hi, Michael

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [calms down] Okay. Okay. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [to Andy] I talked to corporate. Turns out there have been 12 reports of faulty printers. Out of 400,000. [smiles] We've investigated. Every time it's been user error.  They block the vents or something, I don't know. That's why we have the fine print. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. So I'd like to reward you for that. [pulls out gift card] That's god for five bucks at Dunkin' Donuts. Any Dunkin' Donuts. [Andy looks over at Darryl and Darryl motions for Andy to go to him]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? We should really do something fun this week.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Yeah, we should.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wouldn't that be fun?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How about Thursday?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Thursday works. Yeah, what do you wanna do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't do Thursday. Book club. How about Friday?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Oh, Friday doesn't work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, really? 'cause I was thinking we could go to this concert. Spice Girls are opening for Weird Al. Front row. It'd be a great, great concert.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Shoot. I'm working.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh okay. Well, maybe I could stop by.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Well, won't you be at the concert?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope, that's Tuesday.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Oh, well, I can make it on Tuesday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're cheating. You're cheating on me.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: How do you know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam told me. [looks up at 2nd floor windows and so does Donna; Jim, Dwight, and Pam are visible on conference room window, they all scramble as soon as Donna and Michael look up, Pam throwing herself on the floor]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [gasps] Did she see me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Pam on floor] Nice effort.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [in old Michael Scott Paper Company's "office"] We're printing on 24-pound premium stock paper, approximately 300 sheets in. So far, no signs of distress. [Darryl is filming Andy's demonstration]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You haven't even introduced yourself.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Right. My name is Andrew Baines Bernard, and if you're watching this, it's because I've turned State's witness because I'm in danger because I know too much.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You should talk in a higher voice 'cause the camera makes you sound weird.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Higher? Okay. [speaking slightly higher] Recently certain events have come to my attention...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Higher. [motions with hand to go up more]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Make it higher? Okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mm-hmm

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [high-pitched] I have come to the conclusion that the Sabre corporation...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: One more, yeah. [Again motions to go even higher]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [higher] May be overlooking certain safety regulations. At the danger... [printer starts smoking and explodes] ah! [speaking lower] It's working. [in normal voice] It's... I knew it!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This... [removes camera headset]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We are blowin' the roof off! Blowin' the roof off! [Darryl discharges fire extinguisher onto printer] Nice. Nice. This is my partner, Darryl Philbin. He's been my partner through this entire thing.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I don't wanna prank anymore. Things get real. It's not funny. I'm just gonna be good, stay in my room, go to church, try to do one nice thing per day. I do not wanna prank anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who is he?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: What, what do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The other man. Who's the guy? Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: It's you. I'm married.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm the mistress?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on workout bicycle at gym] Okay, everybody, let's take this next hill.

quotes.speaker: Gym Instructor
quotes.text: Excuse me. Yeah, I'd appreciate it if you'd just let me run this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what? You had your chance. You're no leader. Out of your seat, let's blast!

quotes.speaker: Gym Instructor
quotes.text: Don't listen to him, we're approaching a cooldown down a gentle hill.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No! The hill's a trap. Let's take the dirt road off to the side.

quotes.speaker: Gym Instructor
quotes.text: No, guys, no. We're just cooling down...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If they catch us, they will rape us. Go for the cliff. And three, two, one... jump! No! [points to those around him] You're dead, you're dead, you're dead. Good jump. You're barely alive. Okay, now nice cooldown. Check your pulse rate.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: In memory of Larry Einhorn.
